page.title: 16Schools in West Bromwich
page.content: Altogether there are twelve schools in our area. Eight are primary, catering for children aged five to eleven. Some of these schools have nursery and infant facilities catering for younger children. On average about 250 pupils attended each school. The children are taught a full range of subjects and sports.There is also a special school. There are two secondary schools with over a thousand pupils in each, from the age of eleven to eighteen, although most pupils leave at sixteen. Both schools teach a full range of courses, both academic and practical. Many sports are played and there are numerous clubs and out of school visits. Churchfields opened in 1956 and was the first Comprehensive school in the West Midlands. It has a unit for hearing impaired children.
